meanings.definition: The act of dismissing or sending away.
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, the dismission of the employees was swift.
meanings.sent2: His dismission from the job came as a surprise to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The dismission of the noisy students from the classroom brought peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: The dismission of the old ways paved the path for new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The dismission of the guests signaled the end of the party.

meanings.definition: The state of being dismissed or sent away.
meanings.sent1: She felt sadness after her dismission from the team.
meanings.sent2: The dismission of the students at the end of the day was chaotic.
meanings.sent3: The dismission of the cat from the room led to a hunt for the missing toy.
meanings.sent4: The dismission of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent5: The dismission of the old ruler brought hope for a better future.
